tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Finished T74 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.carHigh: 2015: Spent the year on the eGolf Tour and collected his first professional victory, at the Imperial Headwear Southern Open in Kannapolis, N.C., outside his hometown of Raleigh, N.C., in what was just his third start on that circuit.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Qualified for the 2009 U.S. Amateur at age 15..Won the Callaway Junior World Championship three consecutive years from 2006 to 2008...Won the 2010 Rex Hospital Open Junior Invitational, which earned him a spot in the Web.com Tour's Rex Hospital Open. Shot a 66 in the second round to become the second-youngest competitor to make the cut in a Web.com Tour event...Played on the Wake Forest University golf team in 2012 before transferring to Arizona State University, where he played one year.
tourBios.personal: Would be a golf course architect if he did not play professional golf...Would choose any Eric Church song as his walk-up music on the first tee...Earliest golf memory was meeting Arnold Palmer when he was a 9 year old...Biggest thrill in golf was playing in the 2013 U.S. Open at Merion...Would like to trade places with Will Ferrell for a day so he could make everybody laugh...Bucket list items include traveling to Paris and Hawaii...Not many people know the only country outside the U.S. he has visited is the Bahamas...Lists the Tar Heel Golf Foundation and The First Tee as charities he supports.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T55th in 2010 at the The Rex Hospital Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T36th in Current Par or Better Streak on the Web.com Tour.
